com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Frame

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Frame
Direct Known Subclasses:
Canvas, Dialog, Panel
public abstract class Frame
extends java.lang.Object

This supplies the display surface for applications. Frame class designates the interface that must be possessed by the object displayed on the screen.
Events shall be notified to an instance of this class' subclass. However, events shall not be notified to an instance of the invisible frame's subclass.

Field Detail

SOFT_KEY_1

public static final int SOFT_KEY_1
Soft key 1 (=0). Soft key 1 is the soft key on the left and is used for setting the soft key 1 label via the setSoftLabel method. This value is used for the soft key number sent as an argument with the soft key listener.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SOFT_KEY_2

public static final int SOFT_KEY_2
Soft key 2 (=1). Soft key 2 is the soft key on the left and used for setting the soft key 2 label via the setSoftLabel method. This value is used for the soft key number sent as argument with the soft key listener.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

getHeight

public final int getHeight()
This obtains the frame height.

Returns:
The frame height in the pixel units.

getWidth

public final int getWidth()
This obtains the frame width.

Returns:
The frame width in the unit of pixel units.

setBackground

public void setBackground(int color)
This sets the background color. The clearRect method of the Graphics class shall paint the entire rectangular with the color designated here. In default, the implementation dependent color is set.

Parameters:
color - Designates an integer that indicates the background color
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is set for argument color.
See Also:
Graphics.clearRect(int, int, int, int)

setSoftLabel

public void setSoftLabel(int key,
                         java.lang.String label)
This sets the label character string of the soft key. The set label character string is automatically set to the location where the label character string of the soft key is to be displayed when this frame switches to the current frame. If the label character string is changed via this method when this frame is the current frame, the display shall change immediately.

Parameters:
key - Designates the soft key number for setting the label character string. Only SOFT_KEY_1 and SOFT_KEY_2 can be designated.
label - Designates the label character string. When null is designated, the label character string of the soft key is not displayed. When an empty character string is designated, the label of the empty character string is displayed.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument key
